required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of SHR3162 in Healthy Caucasian Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Open-Label, Two-Center Study to Evaluate the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of Single-Dose Fluzoparib in Healthy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and PK characteristics of a single oral dose of fluzoparib in healthy Caucasian and Chinese subjects

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study will enroll a single cohort of healthy Caucasian subjects with an approximately one-to-one ratio of male to female subjects

primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) of SHR3162
Area under the concentration-time curve from time 0 to infinity of SHR3162
Apparent volume of distribution during terminal phase of SHR3162

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to study completion, approximately 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with adverse events (AEs)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to study completion, approximately 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with laboratory tests findings of potential clinical importance

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to study completion, approximately 5 weeks
Screening up to study completion, approximately 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with clinically significant abnormal ECG QT Interval

arm_group.description: Will enroll a single cohort of 12 healthy Caucasian subjects with an approximately one-to-one ratio of male to female subjectssubjects can be enrolled and dosed simultaneously.

intervention.description: Fluzoparib, also known as SHR3162, is an inhibitor of human PARP
